Articles.Content:
Good day Kerbalnaughts!

I'm planning on starting a permadeath series on Youtube, and for those who don't know yet, that basically means once you die it's game over. Now I don't want this to be a series that goes on forever, so I'd like a set of goals or achievements that I need to strive for. I thought it might be a cool idea to get the community involved with these goals instead of thinking of them myself, cause I know you guys are a lot more creative than me, and we can get some really interesting challenges going. If you have any interesting or fun projects, that are realistic and achievable, leave them down below! I'd appreciate your help, and if you're interested in watching me try to complete them, I'll be posting them on my Youtube channel: http://www.youtube.com/xXLeGoldFishXx .

I'm gonna try get the first episode of this series up on Monday 1 July, and from there it'll probably be a weekly thing. I'll have more KSP content up throughout the week, but the permadeath thing will be up each Monday. That's the plan anyway. As I finish challenges, I'll be sure to keep this post updated as well!

1 July, first video in the series, was meant as the first episode, but because of circumstances I've decided to call it episode 0, the announcement of the series on Youtube:

Thanks in advance for your suggestions!

- xXLeGoldFishXx

Edited July 2, 2013 by xXLeGoldFishXx
You should try to land on every planet and moon (execpt Jool), and mabe start a few extraplanetary bases.

Build a mother ship that can send probes or landers onto every Joolian moon.

And bring the Kerbals back in one piece.
Try to go 100 m/s on the stock rover wheels. The method of stoppage (Is that even a word?) doesn't matter.

I think simulated malfunctions might be interesting. Perhaps have a pod on a collision-course with the Mun/Kerbin and you have to rendez-vous with it before it's too late, or return a damaged spaceplane safely back to Kerbin.

Hmmm, that's a very interesting idea, maybe use something like hyperedit to put the situations into play! Although I may use that as a different series, thanks for your input though, really got me thinking

I like this one! Although that may be a little advance, wanna start the perma death series of slightly simpler, so that I don't kill the kerbals straight away xD I'll probably do this further on in the series though
